intro: Erigeron obscurus, commonly known as the darkblue fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Erigeron obscurus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
